clinical_study.brief_title: Behavioral and Electrophysiological Effects of Ketamine in Treatment-Resistant Depression
clinical_study.official_title: Behavioral and Electrophysiological Effects of Ketamine in Treatment-Resistant Depression

brief_summary.textblock: The overarching goal of the present study is to evaluate the effect of a subanesthetic dose of ketamine 24-hour post-injection on resting state functional connectivity, cognitive control, and reward learning.

detailed_description.textblock:
Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) participants with treatment-resistant depression (TRD) will be recruited from McLean's Ketamine clinic. Suitability for Ketamine treatment will be determined as typically done by the service - through evaluation by the clinicians on the staff of the Ketamine Service who perform psychiatric consultations and assessments for Ketamine suitability. Potential subjects will be informed about the study only after they have received a positive consultation at the clinic and have already agreed to receive the treatment.
This study consists of a set of questionnaires, urine drug screen, and electroencephalogram (EEG) recordings.

primary_outcome.measure: Feedback-related positivity (FRP) amplitudes over frontocentral scalp regions in response to rewarded trials versus no-reward trials
primary_outcome.description: Relative FRP response is the primary outcome measure for the probabilistic reward task (PRT).

primary_outcome.measure: Event-related negativity (ERN) amplitudes over frontocentral scalp regions in response to correct trials versus incorrect trials.
primary_outcome.description: Relative ERN response is the primary outcome measure for the flanker task.

primary_outcome.measure: Behavioral Performance on the Probabilistic Reward Task (PRT)
primary_outcome.description: The Probablilistic Reward Task operationalizes positive reinforcement learning

primary_outcome.measure: Behavioral Performance on the Flanker Task
primary_outcome.description: The Flanker Task is a cognitive task that measures response inhibition to assess the ability to suppress responses that are inappropriate in a particular context.

Severity of rumination will be assessed using the Rumination Response Scale (RRS). The RRS has a minimum score of 22 and a maximum score of 88. Higher scores indicate higher degrees of ruminative symptoms.

arm_group.description: Subjects who have no history of clinical depression or other psychological disorder
Subjects experiencing a current episode of Major Depressive Disorder.

study_pop.textblock: We plan to recruit 30 TRD individuals with current MDD without psychotic features and 30 demographically matched healthy controls. All participants will be ketamine-naïve.
